parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The eye; fig: the mind's eye. From optanomai; the eye; by implication, vision; figuratively, envy.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To darken. From skotos; to obscure.
(primarily physical), I look, see, perceive, discern. A primary verb; to look at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The back (of men or animals). Of uncertain affinity; the back.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To oppress, bend together. From sun and kampto; to bend together, i.e. to afflict.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
